Remove redundant entries from the list of folders to search for file
mappings. As we search recursively, we only need topmost folders.

For example, if folder c:\foo is open in sublime, and also files
c:\foo\bar.js, c:\foo\baz\biz.js, and c:\zap, we should boil down to
c:\foo and c:\zap.
When searching to map local files, as well as looking in the currently opened folder, look in folders containing any opened files as well

When Sublime was closed in a layout other than the 3 group layout of SWI,
when it starts again it will open the console in the main group. This is
because when debugging starts, after we set up the 3 group layout, we
are calling close_all_our_windows which sets back to the default layout.

Instead close all our windows only when loading ourselves, and when debugging
stops, not when debuggee starts or debugging starts. Note, it currently
only closes our windows if they are in their expected groups. In case they
aren't, add a call to at least clear them. Future - identify our windows
and close them whereever they are grouped.
Fix possible AV when switching away from file mappings view

Fix the leaking callbacks list in SwiDebugView by implementing
our own erase() that also clears the callbacks.

Just adding an erase() on SwiDebugView did not do it, as the __getattr__
redirected it to the erase() on the backing view. (Not clear why, as
it seems that it is explicitly is not supposed to be called unless
the method is not already on self.)

So I removed the pass-through mechanism in __getattr__ and implemented
explicit passthroughs for everything we use on View. That's more
encapsulated and explicit anyway.

There remains a bug where only a partial erase occurs. It should be
removing some of the callbacks:
self.view.erase(edit, sublime.Region(erase_to, self.view.size()))

Update tokens in tmLanguage files to be actual tokens
that exist at last in the default Monokai theme.
What the tokens should be isn't clear as each theme is different
(for example error won't always be red in other themes) but it's
useful to at least differentiate the tokens rather than just
use foreground.

For future reference, the default themes are zipped inside
Sublime Text 3\Packages\Color Scheme - Default.sublime-package
these can be viewed as text or in http://tmtheme-editor.herokuapp.com/.

To update the tmLanguage files, edit the JSON and then use the
AAAPackageDev sublime plugin to convert them from JSON to PList format
(which is the format that Sublime reads)

When changing the console line prefixes I forgot to update the syntax
file so that they are tokenized correctly.
They aren't getting their own color though.

Some users use query strings as cache breakers
We don't want these to mess up our url mapping.
Strip on url from debuggee, restore on url to debugger, so
this is invisible to our implemention.

Note IE and Chrome tools do show the query string in the tab title,
we could do more work if that is important.

Improve responsiveness of clicking on clickable regions (eg "step into)
Clicking multiple times on the same "button" should work. However, Sublime
tends to fire on_selection_modified aggressively, so some throttling is
necessary.
Removed the check that rejected repeated clicks in the same place as this
is exactly what you want when clicking on a button several times.
Instead rely on throttling. 0.1 seconds seems reasonable.

The ideal solution here is some kind of 'mouse up' and 'mouse down'
notifications (or 'key up' and 'key down').

This might possibly help:
https://github.com/SublimeText/MouseEventListener/blob/master/mouse_event_listener.py

Add common debugging shortcuts:

F5 Resume
F8 Toggle pause/resume (also Ctrl+\)
F10 Step over
F11 Step into
Shift+F11 Step out (also Ctrl+Shift+;)

The shortcuts were chosen to correspond to current behavior of the Chrome
developer tools and the Internet Explorer developer tools, excluding any
shortcuts that are already defined in the default Sublime mappings, with
these exceptions:

Ctrl+Shift+R  Already defined, overrides 'goto symbol'
F11 overrides Toggle full screen
Shift+F11 overrides Toggle distraction free

If the overrides are bothersome, we can change them.

Change current_line to only be set on break; it indicates the instruction
pointer, which is only set on a break. Just jumping from the stack or console
should not cause a highlight.

Uncomment step in, step out, and step over in the command list.
They work fine.

Support optional "chrome_url" setting in the user's settings that causes
the launch of Chrome to start on the page of interest rather than need
navigating.

I notice that for some reason, Chrome will sometimes still open a second tab,
which navigates to its own install directory. I can't figure out how to avoid
that, but the only effect is that it means Sublime gives you an extra URL to
pick from when you do "Start Debugging"

Merge pull request #58 from ithcy/ST3

Implemented architecture detection for Windows chrome executable
Restored chrome executable path for 32-bit windows to "windows" key to maintain backwards compatibility. x64 windows uses "windows_x64".

Implemented architecture detection for Windows chrome executable, so that 32-bit and 64-bit windows each have their own (hopefully correct) path.

This will break existing user settings if the user has a custom path to Chrome. Users must use the key "windows_x64" or "windows_x32" instead of "windows" in their user settings file.
